p: Sofosbuvir was also recently shown to protect against Zika flavivirus (ZIKV) in studies both in vitro and in vivo ( Mesci et al., 2018; Bullard-Feibelman et al., 2017). It has been found that HCV and ZIKV RNA polymerases have very similar active sites, confirming that sofosbuvir could also act on ZIKV-infected cells. It was also demonstrated via cellular assays and animal models that sofosbuvir inhibits the replication of other flaviviruses, such as dengue virus (DENV) ( Xu et al., 2017), yellow fever virus (YFV) ( De Freitas et al., 2019), and chikungunya virus (CHIKV) ( Ferreira et al., 2019).
